12:30.race_name: Sky Sports Racing Sky 415 Open National Hunt Flat Race (Category 1 Elimination) (GBB Race)

runners.comment: Beaten long way at Newbury, having been friendless in the betting
runners.name: Below The Belt
runners.spotlight: Rather modestly bred; beaten long way in Newbury contest, having been friendless in the betting; looks the weakest contender.

runners.comment: Has recorded two modest efforts but is bred to do better
runners.name: King Berry
runners.spotlight: Has recorded two modest efforts (RPR 95 both times) but is bred to do better, being out of a Listed Flat winner for his connections.

runners.comment: Solid second at Newton Abbot, then faced a stiffer task at Cheltenham; the form pick
runners.name: Makingplansfor
runners.spotlight: Solid second at Newton Abbot on debut (form has received a couple of boosts); comfortably held when facing a stiffer assignment in Listed grade at Cheltenham, albeit again registering a triple-digit RPR; sets the standard back down in class.

runners.comment: 9,000euros foal; yard's sole bumper performer this term has recorded two wins; interesting
runners.name: Silk Mountain
runners.spotlight: 9,000euros foal; unraced dam closely related to bumper/2m hurdle winner Frontline, half-sister to 1m6f Flat and smart jumps scorer Castlegrace Paddy, out of 2m Flat/2m hurdle winner; yard's sole bumper performer this term has recorded two wins; interesting newcomer.

runners.comment: Has a Flat pedigree that includes some useful sorts; in good hands; respected debutant
runners.name: Wildes Legacy
runners.spotlight: Dam unraced half-sister to winners Ukrainian (1m3f-1m5f) and Livaleo (10.6f), out of 1m1f-1m2f Listed winning half-sister to useful 1m2f-1m4f scorer Lidakiya (dam of high-class 6f-1m2f performer Linngari); in good hands; respected debutant.

runners.comment: Attracted some support at Newbury, only to run as if something was amiss
runners.name: St Aurelia
runners.spotlight: Attracted some support at Newbury, only to run as if something was amiss; related to a couple of bumper winners and may show promise provided all is well.

13:00.race_name: Free Tips Daily On attheraces.com EBF Junior "National Hunt" Hurdle (GBB Race)

runners.comment: Won very comfortably by 12l at Doncaster last month; ought to be hard to beat
runners.name: Aqua Bleu
runners.spotlight: Out of a half-sister to very useful jumpers Dressedtothenines and Pay The Piper; built upon promising debut when winning very comfortably by 12l at Doncaster (good to soft) last month and ought to be hard to beat here.

runners.comment: Struggled and was pulled up when 28-1 for recent debut at Wincanton
runners.name: Callero
runners.spotlight: Flat-bred who struggled and was pulled up when 28-1 for recent debut at Wincanton (good to soft).

runners.comment: Half-brother to smart chaser Enjoy D'Allen; market may guide on debut
runners.name: Majeur Allen
runners.spotlight: Sixth foal; half-brother to four winners including smart chaser Enjoy D'Allen; dam placed 1m4f AQPS Flat and over jumps; bought for 26,000euros in June; market may guide on debut.

runners.breeder: June Watts Ta Blue Moon Bloodstock
runners.comment: Bettered debut run when respectable third at Wincanton this month; minor prize awaits
runners.name: Network Gold
runners.spotlight: Bettered low-key debut when very respectable third behind well-regarded stablemate of Aqua Bleu at Wincanton (1m7f, good to soft) this month; needs to improve again here but should collect another minor prize.

runners.breeder: June Watts Ta Blue Moon Bloodstock
runners.comment: Behind stablemate Network Gold on both outings, more recently when fourth at Bangor
runners.name: Network Rgb
runners.spotlight: Behind stablemate Network Gold on both outings, more recently when fourth of seven at Bangor (good to soft) this month; has work to do.

runners.comment: Not beaten far when midfield in good-ground Wincanton bumper this month
runners.name: Pink N Purple
runners.spotlight: Half-brother to stable winners The Pink'n (Flat/useful hurdle) and Nelson's Touch (hurdle); dam fair Flat winner; not beaten far when sixth of 12 in good-ground Wincanton bumper last month; makes hurdle debut here.

13:30.race_name: BetWright Bet The Wright Way Mares' Maiden Hurdle (GBB Race)

runners.comment: Pulled up and well beaten in both runs over hurdles, at odds of 300-1 and 200-1
runners.name: My Lovely Horse
runners.spotlight: Pulled up and well beaten in both runs over hurdles, at odds of 300-1 and 200-1.

runners.comment: Difficult to know for sure what she achieved behind a long odds-on winner at Carlisle
runners.name: Oh Clare
runners.spotlight: Difficult to know for sure what she achieved behind a long odds-on winner at Carlisle (2m1f, soft) but entitled to progress with her racing; hard to dismiss.

stable_tour.quote: She ran a lovely race on her first start in a bumper at Carlisle and we thought she'd win next time, but she came home quite sick and that ended her season. It was a lovely first run over hurdles at Carlisle last week and she probably bumped into a good one. We hope she'll shape up into a nice novice in the mares' division this season. 18-11-25

runners.comment: 0-17 under rules and holds very weak claims on hurdles and chase form
runners.name: Raindance Queen
runners.spotlight: 0-17 under rules and holds very weak claims on hurdles and chase form.

runners.comment: Good chance on bumper form and 7-2 when departing early on hurdling debut at Hereford
runners.name: Rock Sensation
runners.spotlight: Southwell bumper winner who then ran fourth in a Listed race at Cheltenham (soft); 7-2 when departing early on hurdling debut at Hereford; good chance.

stable_tour.quote: She's a speedier type than Queenofthejukebox and won nicely on her second start in a bumper at Southwell. We're likely to start her off in the Listed mares' bumper at Cheltenham on November 15. If she's working well enough up to then, we'll be inclined to give her a crack at that and then she'll probably go hurdling. 22-10-25

runners.comment: Placed in a point and in all her four starts over hurdles; sets the standard
runners.name: Sea Presenting
runners.spotlight: Placed in a point and in all her four starts over hurdles, last time finishing runner-up over C&D after a wind operation; sets the standard.

stable_tour.quote: She's doing great. She's grown an awful lot since last season - we had to stop our season a little early last year as she had a stress fracture behind when we were planning to run in the Grade 2 mares' final at Newbury. We had to stop that early, and she also had to have a little soft- palate surgery this season. That meant we started a bit later than ideal, but we were very pleased with her first run back at Lingfield in late November - I think the winner [Broomfield Aderra] is quite nice. I'm sure she'll be losing her maiden tag soon. I'd like to get some black type into her and I think she's more than capable of that. So, we'll see if we can get her qualified for the mares' final at Newbury again and we may look at the 3m Listed novice at Doncaster at the end of February and work our way towards that if all goes smoothly. She's a lovely mare who's definitely grown again this year and is still developing. We'll be having a lot of fun with her this season I hope. 17-12-25

runners.comment: Uttoxeter bumper winner; now goes in a hood but should have a future over hurdles
runners.name: Sevarana
runners.spotlight: Sister to useful bumper/jumps winners Sevarano and Fire Flyer; built on her promising debut to win a good-ground bumper at Uttoxeter in July; now goes in a hood but should have a future over hurdles.

runners.comment: Bumped into a smart one last time but has a good bit to find on RPRs
runners.name: Shesonnet
runners.spotlight: No match for a smart one at Uttoxeter (2m, soft) last month and highly likely that she'll need a lot more here, according to RPRs.

runners.comment: Off since underwhelming handicap debut in March but had summer wind op; still unexposed
runners.name: George Henry
runners.spotlight: Made underwhelming handicap debut when third of four at Wincanton (2m5f, good) in March and has not raced since but was given a wind op during the summer and remains open to improvement for his top stable.

runners.comment: 0-5 over hurdles but last month's 2m5f fourth was respectable; upped in trip again here
runners.name: Block Rockin Beats

quotes.race: Junior Jumpers Open National Hunt Flat Race (Category 1 Elimination) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Block Rockin Beats got his head down and kept on trying. Gav gave him a brilliant ride and for a small yard like ours it's great have a winner at Cheltenham, it's big for the team. He had been working very well at home and I thought he had a chance but these bumpers are always hot. Hopefully he is an exciting horse to go forward with. He jumps very well so I think we will make use of that and go hurdling when he has got over today. I think he should go on soft ground and he has also shown today that he goes on good ground - Oliver Signy, trainer.

runners.spotlight: Yet to transfer his useful bumper form to hurdles but bettered disappointing seasonal/handicap debut when keeping on from the rear for respectable fourth at Kempton (2m5f, good) last month, and this stiffer stamina test might unlock more improvement.

stable_tour.quote: He's had two very good bumper runs, most recently when second in a Listed contest. We'll go for a novice maiden hurdle at the end of the month, maybe at Doncaster, and we're aiming to get to the Turners Novices' Hurdle at the festival. If we're going to aim for Cheltenham you need as much experience on the track as possible. 18-12-24

runners.comment: 2m4f winner in first-time cheekpieces two starts ago; tries a new tirip today
runners.name: Diamond Geezer
runners.spotlight: Came good in first-time cheekpieces at Perth (2m4f, soft; front pair clear) in October, his sixth hurdling start; not quite in same form when third at Warwick (2m3f, soft) last month but might have untapped potential over this longer trip.

runners.comment: Absent since struggling in two Irish beginners' chases in early 2023; best watched
runners.name: Rock On Cassie

quotes.race: Punchestown Members Club Mares' Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: Rock On Cassie is a mare that we will have a bit of fun with and she will jump a fence too - Gordon Elliott, trainer.

runners.spotlight: Won 2m4f maiden hurdle for Gordon Elliott in early 2022 but absent since struggling in two beginners' chases in February/March 2023 and can only be watched on stable debut.

stable_tour.quote: A Punchestown bumper winner who was in the process of running a big race when he came down two out in a Listed race at Navan. She'll pay her way this season. 18-10-22

runners.breeder: S R L Az Agr Razza Della Sila
runners.comment: Never really got going during light campaign last season; current ability hard to gauge
runners.name: Fontana Ellissi

prev_owners.owner: Walters Plant Hire & West Coast Haulage

quotes.race: Watch On RacingTV Novices' Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: The better ground has certainly helped Fontana Ellissi. We'd have hoped he had improved coming into today, and we'd been patient with him waiting for better ground - we ran him in a jumpers' bumper last time. He's been crying out for it so it's nice that he's got his head in front. He jumped his hurdles quite big, which is great, and he seems straightforward. Sam Twiston-Davies, jockey.

runners.spotlight: Very well handicapped on old form but lightly raced in recent years and never really got going during three-race campaign last season; cheekpieces (worn for last two starts) discarded for this reappearance run; current ability hard to gauge.

runners.comment: Third on both hurdle starts (2m3f/2m4f); up in trip for handicap debut; has potential
runners.name: Harmony Heights
runners.owner: M Songer, C Bailey & M Dodd
runners.spotlight: Made the frame on both hurdling starts, more recently when third in mares' maiden at Uttoxeter (2m4f, heavy) five weeks ago; needs to improve to make winning handicap debut here but moves up in trip and has potential.

runners.comment: Back from long absence in fairly good form this autumn but may prefer better ground
runners.name: Night Stalker
runners.spotlight: Back from long absence with four fairly good runs this autumn, finishing just ahead of Block Rockin Beats when third at Kempton (2m5f, good) two starts ago, but may not be ideally suited by the slower ground here.

runners.comment: Small-field C&D winner in February and returned from break with two decent autumn runs
runners.name: Icaque De Lisle

prev_owners.owner: Jacques Toulouse, E Clayeux Et Al

runners.spotlight: Won small-field C&D (heavy) handicap in February; that was a very modest race but he returned from a break with another two good efforts this autumn (2m4f/3m1f) and probably won't be far away.

runners.comment: Bounced back to form with C&D win in February; returns from ten-month break today
runners.name: Has Troke
runners.spotlight: Pulled up in consecutive chases last winter but bounced back to form with C&D (heavy) hurdle win in February; not easy to predict after ten-month absence but 3lb rise ought to be manageable.

stable_tour.quote: A winner in France for Alain Couetil before joining us earlier this year. He had a couple of quiet runs in the spring as he was becoming acclimatised to us and did well for his summer break. On his return at Market Rasen he was going nicely before falling at the last flight, and but for that would have finished second. It was a very novicey fall but he is in good order again e. He is a lovely individual who will make a chaser in time. 30-12-21

runners.comment: Didn't fire at Southwell recently but has good claims if judged on last month's C&D second
runners.name: My Cullen
runners.spotlight: Didn't fire at Southwell 19 days ago and now 0-7 over hurdles but gave good account when second over C&D (good to soft) two starts ago and has obvious claims if judged on that performance.

14:30.race_name: BeatWright Beat The Wright Way Handicap Chase (GBB Race)

runners.comment: Won two Fontwell chases in March and battled on well for second there last month
runners.name: Diplomatic Ash

quotes.race: BetGoodwin Handicap Chase (Fontwell Chase Series Qualifier) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Diplomatic Ash did that well considering we didn't think he'd like the ground - Gary Moore, joint-trainer, speaking to Sky Sports Racing.

runners.spotlight: Won two Fontwell chases in March (2m3f/2m2f) and battled on well for second in small field there (2m3f, good to soft) last month, after a break; nudged up to another career-high mark here but can still make his presence felt; swaps cheekpieces (worn for last four races) for blinkers.

runners.comment: Made all at Plumpton in February but too inconsistent to rely upon nowadays
runners.name: Alto Alto

quotes.race: BetGoodwin Master Trainer Chris Gordon Handicap Chase (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Alto Alto was a different horse to the last time I rode him. I couldn't keep him on the bridle last time at Windsor but today he's completely changed with the visor on. A small-runner field and getting his own way in front has made a massive difference and he just loves Plumpton - Freddie Gordon, jockey, speaking to Sky Sports Racing.

quotes.race: Zoe Davison Memorial Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: Alto Alto is the first one of mine who has ground it out for a very long time. It's been a frustrating period, most of them just haven't seen it out. We put a tongue-tie on him which he maybe needed for his wind - Chris Gordon, trainer,

runners.spotlight: Made all in first-time visor at Plumpton (2m1f, soft) in February and is only 1lb higher here but has become very inconsistent in recent years and needs to bounce back from last month's disappointing seasonal debut.

stable_tour.quote: He's been a grand horse. He cost the owner £21,000 and he's won five races and has been brilliant. His five wins have all come at Plumpton and he seems to save his best for that venue - a bit like his trainer really. He won there again last time but there isn't really anything suitable for him for a while. There's a Fontwell 0-120 handicap we might look at and a couple of other races, but we'll keep him in as low a grade as we possibly can. Some horses can throw the towel in a bit when they're in a race that's a little bit too tough, but when they're in a field where they've got a scent of victory, like he had at Plumpton last time, it's very different. He's very much one of those horses. 26-02-25

runners.comment: Won over hurdles in the spring but safely held in two 2m4f chases this autumn
runners.name: Windsurfer

quotes.race: British EBF "National Hunt" Novices' Hurdle (Qualifier) (GBB Race) (Div II)
quotes.quote: Windsurfer will probably run in another novice under a penalty but he's a chaser really - Ben Case, trainer, talking to Sky Sports Racing.

runners.spotlight: Won 2m4f Uttoxeter hurdle (good ground) from the front in June but safely held over that trip in two chases this autumn (hampered on first occasion; jumped left last time); should cope with this drop back to 2m but still needs to prove himself over fences.

runners.comment: Quirky customer who was well beaten on last month's chasing debut
runners.name: Boston Boy
runners.spotlight: Had very mixed record over hurdles and is a bit of a character (ran out in consecutive races last autumn); well beaten on last month's chasing debut at Huntingdon (2m, good), after a break, and needs to have taken significant benefit from that outing.

stable_tour.quote: I thought he'd run a little better than he did in his bumpers, but we've switched a few things up and I expect to see a lot more from him this season over hurdles. He took a good blow at the second-last at Uttoxeter on Friday but travelled with a lot of zest and jumped well to that point. Ultimately he's going to be a staying chaser, but I'd like to think he'll be able to pick up a maiden hurdle off the back of that run. 06-11-24

runners.comment: Won twice at Ffos Las last month and didn't run badly at Haydock since; respected
runners.name: Jaipaletemps

prev_owners.owner: Ecurie Herve Guerin, Gabriel Leenders & David Lumet

runners.spotlight: Returned from break with two soft-ground wins at Ffos Las last month (2m/2m3f; both under Rian Corcoran); had to settle for third at Haydock (2m4f, good to soft) 18 days ago but that certainly wasn't a bad run and he remains of interest.

runners.comment: Made fairly encouraging chase debut last month and might come on for the run
runners.name: Hors Jeu

prev_owners.owner: Jacques Detre, Patrice Detre & Ecurie Team Spirit

runners.spotlight: French hurdle winner in spring 2024; safely held in four British hurdle races last season but made made fairly encouraging chase debut when fourth of six at Wetherby (1m7f, soft) last month and might come on for the run.

runners.comment: Unexposed in Britain and ran okay in recent 3m hurdle; back at 2m for chase return
runners.name: Jeu Dopale
runners.spotlight: French chase winner in 2022; returned from long absence with two disappointing hurdle runs for new stable in February but put in good front-running shift before weakening at Ludlow (3m, good to soft) this month; dropped sharply in trip for this return to fences and will presumably be ridden very positively again.

15:00.race_name: BetWright Safer Gambling Handicap Chase (GBB Race)

runners.comment: Has gone the wrong way but this is a notable drop in class so he may stage a turnaround
runners.name: Tahmuras

quotes.race: William Hill Cheltenham NRMB From January 1st Novices' Limited Handicap Chase (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Stepping up in trip has probably helped Tahmuras. He's been a brilliant horse and it's nice to see him put in a performance like that as we thought he would be a better chaser than a hurdler - Noel Fehily, syndicate manager.

quotes.race: Unibet Tolworth Novices' Hurdle (Grade 1) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Tahmuras just gets better with every run. The pace he showed through the race today, he was the last off the bridle, he's just improving every time. I think a fairly serious horse on our hands. I was a little worried because the ground looked really chewed up and you never know how a young horse is going to handle it, but I loved the way he turned into the straight and Harry was riding him with loads of confidence. He looks like he's getting quicker with every run, which really impressed me. Paul and his team has done a fantastic job with him. Roll on Cheltenham. He'll be in both races at the festival and we'll speak to Paul and see what he wants to do, but he'll definitely be staying in the Supreme and Ballymore and we'll make a decision nearer the time. He looks pretty good.   He's right up there with any of the ones I've known. He's quite similar to Summerville Boy, who I won the race on and went on to win the Supreme. He stayed a lot further than two miles but this fellow jumps a lot better than him and is a good staying horse with a bit of quality. He can travel over two miles, which is impressive - Noel Fehily, syndicate manager.      He's very much in the model of Al Ferof and Noland, both of which won the Supreme for us. They weren't real speedy two milers but they won at Cheltenham because they stay. He travelled so well there, we can sharpen his jumping up and I'd say he'll all but certain run in the Supreme. It's the sort of race, if the ground goes soft, which would suit him very well. I'm looking forward to him, he's another nice horse to have - Paul Nicholls, trainer.

quotes.race: Betfair Weighed In Podcast Newton Novices' Hurdle (Listed Race) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: It was a very nice surprise when Tahmuras won so easily at Chepstow. That was a good step forward and he'll go straight to the Tolworth Hurdle at Sandown now. That track will suit him better than the easy two miles round here. He's a super horse and I'm very pleased. He's one of our better novice hurdlers - Paul Nicholls, trainer.

quotes.race: Your New tote Open Maiden National Hunt Flat Race (Category 3 Elimination) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Tahmuras is a big baby and we'll probably leave him alone now. I imagine that's him done for this season and he'll be a lovely horse for novice hurdles next term. That's his job, maybe over two and a half miles, but I'd like to think he's got a bit of quality. All the right horses were there and we were giving weight to the second. He wouldn't want quick - he's a proper winter horse - Noel Fehily, owners' representative.

runners.spotlight: Very useful novice chaser who has gone the wrong way; however, this is a notable drop in class so he may stage a turnaround.

stable_tour.quote: He was clearly affected by whatever was troubling a lot of ours in the middle part of last season. We just have to put a line through it and try to get him back on track as when he's right he's useful and I still think there's a decent prize to be won with him. That said, he may not be the easiest to place as I'm not sure the handicapper has done him any favours. The Peter O'Sullevan Chase at Newbury's Coral Gold Cup meeting - over two miles six furlongs, which may be his ideal trip - is uppermost in my thoughts at the moment. 04-11-25

He provided us with an amazing day when winning the Tolworth and clearly has plenty of ability. The handicapper probably has a hold of him at the moment and he's not quite up to Graded class. He'll drop into the right race in time but is probably finding it tough off his current mark. 22-10-25

runners.comment: Six chase runs have yeilded two wins and as many seconds; comeback 4th was encouraging
runners.name: Doctor Ken

quotes.race: Boylesports Novices' Limited Handicap Chase (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Doctor Ken jumped very well on the whole. He's a gorgeous big horse who is hopefully going to improve. A lot of mine have needed a run this season and I was waiting for him to take a blow, which he didn't. He was tough and is one to look forward to - Olly Murphy, trainer.

quotes.race: Ascot Shop "National Hunt" Maiden Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Doctor Ken is probably more a horse for next year. In terms of raw ability I'd say he wouldn't be far away from the best of them (his novice hurdlers) but probably mentally and physically he's going to be better next year whereas I might have a few others who are a bit sharper than him - Olly Murphy, trainer.

runners.spotlight: Six chase runs have yeilded two wins and as many seconds; wasn't beaten far when fourth on comeback run at Kempton (3m, good) and has further races in him off this mark.

stable_tour.quote: He's going to slip into the veterans' category in the new year. He's got plenty of ability and had a good run at Kempton last year before picking up a niggle. Two and a half miles was too sharp for him around Perth in April. He's definitely capable of picking up a nice veterans' chase. 23-10-25

He had a good season last season, winning two chases, and is going to be a good staying chaser. I'm not sure where he'll start out just yet, but hopefully he's one to keep on the right side of. 01-11-23

runners.comment: Well handicapped and fully entitled to find plenty on his comeback form at Fontwell
runners.name: Bucksy Des Epeires

quotes.race: CopyBet Novices' Limited Handicap Chase (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: We were a bit concerned about the ground, but it was Bucksy Des Epeires' first run over fences and he was a little bit novicey early on. He warmed to it and I always hoped he'd be a better chaser, so it was nice to do it - especially at Ascot - Venetia Williams, trainer.

runners.spotlight: Beat three rivals off 2lb lower at Ascot last November (2m3f, good; fine on softer); could easily leave behind his reappearance effort at Fontwell, with his yard having found some form in the meantime.

stable_tour.quote: He won his first novice chase at Ascot last season and, while he didn't manage to add to that success, he's still young and I think capable of better. He was second at Doncaster to The Kalooki Kid, who then won a £100,000 handicap chase at Musselburgh, so there's some substance to his form, and he goes well at home. 22-10-25

runners.comment: Moved well for long way before tiring when trying fences again last time; now tongue tied
runners.name: Dartmoor Pirate
runners.spotlight: Useful hurdler who has only raced twice over fences, returning to this discipline at Chepstow where he travelled well for a long way before weakening; that was after a long break and now has a tongue-tie fitted; much respected.

stable_tour.quote: He's one we're excited about. He was fourth in the EBF Final and will go novice chasing. He jumps really nicely and we hope he'll make up into a Graded-class horse. We're working back from the new novice handicap chase at the Cheltenham Festival which could be a great race for him if he does well. 14-11-24

He ran in the Newbury sales bumper and Rex Dingle got trapped a little out wide on him. I'm really pleased with him and he's working smartly. He's got a lovely pedigree - he's a half-brother to Barizan, who was second in the Triumph. We'll really fancy him when he runs in a bumper, then we'll probably go hurdling. 12-10-23

runners.comment: Clearcut C&D winner a month ago; up 6lb for that but gets in here off a handy weight
runners.name: No Tackle

quotes.race: At The Races Supports SGWeek25 Handicap Chase (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Robbie and his team do a good job with No Tackle, as he's actually had a defibrillating heart a couple of times in the past, which is why his form has always been a little in and out. The way he won his two races at Leicester suggested he's good enough to compete, but you're never quite sure what type of horse is going to turn up on the day. If we knew how he was going to perform, I'm sure the owners would have had a few quid in their pocket - Liam Harrison, jockey.

quotes.race: Every Race Live On Racing TV Handicap Chase
quotes.quote: Last year when No Tackle won here he had an atrial fibrillation. He did the same at Windsor first time out. When it doesn't happen, he's a useful horse - Kevin Glastonbury, owner-breeder.

runners.spotlight: His first two chase wins were on soft ground (at Leicester) and had the visor back on when a clearcut winner over C&D (good) a month ago; up 6lb for that but gets in here off a handy weight.

stable_tour.quote: He has a nice pedigree and I know it really well as I used to ride his dam when she was with Tim Vaughan -  all of those on the dam's side were born and bred in Wales. He won really well at Leicester last week. He looked really well handicapped on his old form for Sam Drinkwater but we hadn't had him very long before we first ran him and he had an irregular heartbeat, which we got checked out by the vets. But it all came back into sync prior to Leicester and his work was good. He looks one who could be progressive over fences and he could be a nice staying chaser who might go to a higher level for us. 01-02-24

15:30.race_name: At The Races App Expert Tips Conditional Jockeys' Novices' Handicap Hurdle

runners.comment: 3-3 in 2m-2m4f handicaps since returning from a break and he's a 5yo on the upgrade
runners.name: Low Expectations
runners.spotlight: Has gone 3-3 in 2m-2m4f handicaps since returning from a break, last time justifying odds-on with a fairly decisive win at Plumpton (soft); has a further 7lb rise to deal with but he's a 5yo on the upgrade.

stable_tour.quote: The expectations are a bit higher now as he has won his last two starts, including at Plumpton on Monday. I think he was prepared quickly to be sold in Ireland, after he'd come third in a bumper at Downpatrick in September last year. He was cheap and it's taken him this long to get acclimatised and learn how to race, and in the process he's handicapped himself. He had a good summer break and is now a completely different horse. His jumping is electric. How good he is, I don't know, but he's on an upward curve. We have to make the decision when to go chasing with him - we either go in the second half of this season or wait until next season. I think he'll be just as exciting over fences too. 03-12-25

runners.breeder: E A R L Haras Denki
runners.comment: Made joint-favourite for September's stable debut but was in the rear division throughout
runners.name: Jhentong Enki
runners.spotlight: Ex-Irish 6yo who was made joint-favourite for September's stable debut but was in the rear division throughout; remains unexposed but clearly needs to take a big step forward here.

runners.comment: Never threatened in his second handicap, at Exeter, and others are preferred
runners.name: Washington Singer
runners.spotlight: Only 9-2 when unseating early in his first handicap but was a bigger price at Exeter (2m2f, soft) and never threatened; others preferred.

runners.breeder: E A R L De Faydeau
runners.comment: Switched here from Ascot on Friday and could be interesting on his handicap debut
runners.name: Known Warrior
runners.spotlight: A respectable bumper run and beaten 11l when running his best race in maidens; withdrawn from a competitive race (would have been handicap debut) at Ascot on Friday; could have a part to play.

runners.comment: Made a respectable handicap debut at Windsor and now downgraded over a longer trip
runners.name: Little Ledgend
runners.spotlight: Showed promise in bumpers (on soft) and was beaten 7l in a Class 3 on handicap debut at Windsor (good to soft); this drop in class and the longer trip heightens interest.

runners.comment: Best two runs in handicaps have come on good ground so this surface casts some doubts
runners.name: Bells Of Ufford
runners.spotlight: Has run moderately in two handicap hurdles but competitive in the other two, perhaps significantly on good ground; this forecast softer surface might not be ideal for him.

12:15.race_name: Sky Bet Acca Freeze Mares' Novices' Handicap Hurdle

runners.comment: Maiden; only fourth of five finishers over C&D on most recent attempt under this code
runners.name: Alvesta
runners.spotlight: Record of 0-21 on Flat and 0-5 over hurdles; only fourth of five finishers over C&D on most recent attempt under this code; needs some improvement to defy top weight and get off the mark.

runners.comment: Ex-Irish maiden who may improve for this drop back in trip; third start for new stable
runners.name: Keep It Cool
runners.spotlight: Ex-Irish maiden who has an inconsistent record and isn't particularly solid on her two efforts over 2m4f for new yard; however, gives the impression she may improve for this drop back in trip.

runners.comment: Some encouraging form for Alison Thorpe, most recently second in Sedgefield maiden hurdle
runners.name: Yanka Blue
runners.spotlight: Showed some encouraging form for Alison Thorpe, most recently second in maiden hurdle at Sedgefield (2m1f, good); possibilities, provided she's able to show progress for new stable.

runners.comment: Returns from 19-month absence and makes debut for James Owen; heed the market signals
runners.name: Our Nel
runners.owner: Keith F J Loads Et Al
runners.spotlight: Made the frame several times, including over hurdles, for Harry Fry; returns from 19-month absence and makes debut for James Owen, having changed hands for 6,500gns; heed the market signals.

runners.comment: Weak claims on form; chance depends on how well she responds to added cheekpieces
runners.name: Crackerjack Queen
runners.spotlight: Still a maiden and holds weak claims on overall form (points/rules); chance largely depends on how well she responds to the addition of cheekpieces in this second handicap attempt.

runners.comment: Bumper winner; form has deteriorated since switched to hurdles
runners.name: Noble Miss
runners.spotlight: Successful in bumper for previous yard; form has deteriorated since switched to hurdles, albeit she perhaps did too much up front over C&D (handicap debut) most recently.

runners.comment: Made a bold bid at Southwell last time, suggesting there's possibly a modest race in her
runners.name: Hello Sweety
runners.spotlight: Headstrong sort who remains a maiden but made a bold bid at Southwell (2m, good to soft) most recently, soon clear and collared only on the run-in; that good second suggests there's possibly a modest race in her.

runners.comment: May show progress now handicapping off bottom weight in the retained headgear
runners.name: Casual Encounter
runners.spotlight: Modest maiden on Flat; ran well on the figures, with cheekpieces fitted, on latest attempt in maiden hurdles; may show progress now handicapping off bottom weight in the retained headgear.

12:45.race_name: Sky Bet Extra Places Handicap Hurdle

runners.comment: Early promise over hurdles, but twice well held since returning; has something to prove
runners.name: Sleeping Late
runners.spotlight: Promise over hurdles earlier in year but held in both starts since returning last month, ending up well beaten after a late mistake on handicap debut at Huntingdon (2m, good to soft) last time; has something to prove.

runners.comment: Up 7lb in hat-trick bid; drying ground would help, but still a major player
runners.name: Zenato

prev_owners.owner: The Trip To Syndicate And Partners

quotes.race: Fairfax & Favor Juvenile Maiden Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Zenato was very free when he came to us off the Flat. We're still getting to know him. I thought he was beaten and he had to be tough ? he showed a great attitude. It sometimes takes horses a few runs to adjust, but hopefully he'll take confidence from that experience - Jonathan Burke, jockey.

runners.spotlight: 2-2 under Fern O'Brien following wins on good ground at Stratford (2m) and Sedgefield (2m1f); up another 7lb and drying ground would probably help (albeit his Flat win came on soft ground), but still a major player for last year's winning stable.

runners.comment: Bumper winner and placed in all three starts over hurdles; a player on handicap debut
runners.name: Merely A Detail
runners.spotlight: Bumper winner who has been placed in all three starts over hurdles, probably running into a couple of nice types when third of five at Exeter (2m3f, good to soft; first-time tongue-tie) last month; a player on handicap debut.

runners.comment: Dual Flat/hurdles winner; fairly treated but needs to put latest modest effort behind him
runners.name: Snapius

quotes.race: Welcome To Student Raceday 2023 Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: Snapius would have hated that ground but he got a great ride. I suppose it was a weak enough race but we couldn't be confident on that ground. He will race on over the summer and he will mix it with the Flat - James Nash, trainer

quotes.race: LimerickRaces.ie Median Auction Maiden
quotes.quote: I rode Snapius the last day in Listowel when I had a bad draw and around there is isn't ideal and was stuck three-wide the whole way which didn't suit. Once I got him straightened up he was still green but finished out his race well today and has come on again. His brother Snapraeterea was fourth in Ascot yesterday (Hampton Court Stakes) and he is from a very consistent family - Mikey Sheehy, jockey.

runners.spotlight: Flat/hurdle winner in Ireland who is 1-14 since joining this yard, the win coming at Lingfield (2m, soft) a year ago; has run well off higher marks since, but needs to put a modest effort at Leicester (2m, heavy; has won on similar ground) 11 days ago behind him.

stable_tour.quote: I bought him very cheaply at £2,500. We were running him on the Flat but I think we've found the key to him now. He'll win on the Flat, but we've popped him over hurdles the last few times. He's been second and then won before Christmas at Lingfield, so he's going the right way. 01-01-25

runners.comment: Promise in first two hurdle starts, but last of six on handicap debut; enough to prove
runners.name: Codetalker
runners.spotlight: 0-5 in points; promise in first two starts over hurdles including when a close second of four over C&D (good to soft) in October, but last of six on handicap debut at Warwick (2m3f, soft) last month; return to this trip may help, but enough to prove.

runners.comment: Third on stable debut at Chepstow last month; interesting to see if she can build on it
runners.name: Miss Maxfort
runners.spotlight: Struggled in handicap hurdles in Ireland after winning a Wexford maiden (2m, soft) in October last year, but finished a promising third of 12 on stable debut at Chepstow (2m, soft; 50-1) last month; interesting to see if she can build on it down 1lb.

13:15.race_name: Sky Bet Queen Boudicca Series Qualifier Mares' Handicap Chase (Queen Boudicca Mares' Qual') (GBB)

runners.comment: In good form, but up 3lb and not sure the drop in trip on a sharp track is ideal
runners.name: Tankardstown Diva

quotes.race: Choose Fibrus Broadband Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: I was a bit worried about stepping up in trip with Tankardstown Diva as she can be hard on herself but she's learning - Ian Donoghue, trainer.

runners.spotlight: Won twice on good ground over hurdles (2m7f/3m) in October and made a creditable return to fences (0-7) when second of five finishers (clear of the third) at Uttoxeter (3m, good to soft) last month; clearly in good form, but up 3lb and not sure the drop in trip on a sharp track is ideal.

runners.comment: Makes chase debut after eight months off; market should be revealing; cheekpieces on
runners.name: I Am The Moon
runners.spotlight: Handy sort who mostly ran well after winning at Warwick (2m3f, good to soft) in January; makes her chase debut in first-time cheekpieces after eight months off and the return to this sort of trip should suit; market should be revealing.

runners.comment: Stepping back up in trip should suit, but she may not get her own way in front
runners.name: Settle Down Jill
runners.spotlight: Winning Irish pointer who made all over hurdles at Chepstow in October and has shown some ability over fences, albeit her two runner-up finishes came in three-runner fields including here (2m, good); stepping back up in trip should suit, but she may not get her own way in front.

runners.comment: Won this in 2023, but showed nothing on her return from pointing last month
runners.name: Jacks Touch

quotes.race: Weatherbys Hamilton Mares' Handicap Chase (Challenger Mares' Chase Series Qualifier)
quotes.quote: Jack's Touch is in a good place at the moment when the ground is right for her and we could go up in trip with her in the future -Sarah Humphrey, trainer.

quotes.race: Sky Bet Build A Bet Mares' Handicap Chase
quotes.quote: That was a good performance to win under 12 stone around here on that ground. Jacks Touch jumped better than when she won at Leicester the time before last - Darly Jacob, jockey.

runners.spotlight: Won three times over fences in the winter of 2023/24 season including this race from 2lb lower, but she finished a long last of five finishers on her return from pointing at Huntingdon (3m, good to soft) last month; look elsewhere.

runners.comment: Just 1lb higher than when winning easily over C&D on New Year's Day; may be worth chancing
runners.name: Gazette Bourgeoise

quotes.race: Queen Boudicca Last Chance To Qualify Mares' Handicap Chase (Queen Boudicca Mares' Chase Qualifier)
quotes.quote: We have not long had Gazette Bourgeoise's wind done, so we were thinking of the final, but when we saw this pot we thought it was mad not to have a go - Alex Harvey, owner.

runners.spotlight: Hasn't shown much in her last three starts, but is just 1lb higher than when winning easily over C&D (good to soft) on New Year's Day and the form of that race worked out incredibly well; may be worth chancing.

runners.comment: Off since April, but has gone well fresh before and remains unexposed; respected
runners.name: Overabottleofred
runners.spotlight: Flattered by the winning margin when off the mark at Leicester (3m, good) in April and has been off since, but she has gone well fresh before and remains unexposed; respected.

13:45.race_name: Sky Bet Build A Bet Maiden Hurdle (GBB Race)

runners.comment: Four-time Flat winner at up to 1m6f; this trip should be within range on hurdles debut
runners.name: High Point

quotes.race: British EBF Ruby Anniversary Nursery Handicap (Sire And Dam Restricted Race)
quotes.quote: High Point ran a nice race at Windsor last time and we were quite confident coming in as he is a galloping type. He could get a mile and three quarters next year - George Downing, rider.

runners.spotlight: Four-time Flat winner including for this yard in September; won at up to 1m6f on the level, so this trip should be within range on hurdles debut; market should be informative.

runners.comment: Winning pointer; well held both hurdle races but latest is best hurdles form in this field
runners.name: Kilbakanto
runners.spotlight: Picked up for £100,000 after winning an Irish point a year ago; well held in both starts over hurdles (2m4f/3m) but he was sent off just 2-1 on the first occasion and his fourth of five at Haydock last time is the best hurdles form in this field; early days and a hood is now given a go.

stable_tour.quote: He won his only point-to-point, having gone into it with a big reputation, but it surprised us how much he needed his first run over hurdles at Uttoxeter, even though it was a very satisfactory start. There's a good bit to come from him and he'll make a fine chaser. 10-11-25

runners.comment: Showed some promise in a couple of Irish points but has shown little under rules
runners.name: Kings Order
runners.spotlight: Showed some promise in a couple of Irish points but has shown little under rules, looking beaten when falling two out at Taunton (2m, good) last time; best watched for now.

runners.comment: Well beaten in two bumpers for Paul Webber; worth a market check on stable/hurdle debut
runners.name: Lawsky
runners.spotlight: Beaten a long way in two bumpers for Paul Webber in the spring of last year; has a nice pedigree and worth a market check on stable/hurdle debut after 20 months off.

stable_tour.quote: He had a small setback and missed last season but he's a quality-looking horse and should do quite well over hurdles. 24-10-25

runners.comment: Closely related to Ahoy Senor; showed ability in bumpers; respected on hurdle debut
runners.name: Tony Joe
runners.spotlight: Closely related to the high-class Ahoy Senor; has shown ability in bumpers, narrowly winning on stable debut after 11 months off at Hexham in October and probably putting up a better performance when fourth of 12 under his penalty at Catterick last month; respected on hurdle debut.

runners.comment: Second of five on hurdle debut at Catterick last month; shortlisted
runners.name: Jonquilla
runners.spotlight: Hinted at ability on her bumper debut at Warwick in February and improved when second of five on her return/hurdle debut at Catterick (2m3f, good) last month; shortlisted.

14:15.race_name: Sky Bet Super Sub Female Jockeys' Handicap Chase (Female Professional Jockeys/Amateur Riders') (GBB)

runners.comment: 1lb lower than when making all in this race last year; has to be taken seriously
runners.name: Frere Darmes

quotes.race: Coral Racing Club Novices' Limited Handicap Chase (For The Fulke Walwyn Trophy) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Frere d'Armes has got a fabulous attitude and jumping is obviously his game. He was impressive at Kempton last time. It's much better ground today but that didn't worry us as he's an accurate mover - I don't think he's a really soft ground horse.  It was a brilliant performance and I'll need a vet's opinion on a cut he has on his leg. I hope it's cosmetic and I'm not in a massive rush with him, so I don't think we want to ask him too many big questions too soon. I'd rather give him time and the cut will force that, but I don't think that's a  bad thing. Even if he didn't run until February I wouldn't mind and we'll see how the novice looks, but something like the Pendil could suit - Dan Skelton, trainer.

quotes.race: EBF "National Hunt" Novices' Hurdle (Qualifier) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Frere D'Armes has done it well. He bumped into a nice one the last day. I couldn't have asked for any more from him and it's a good platform to build on - Harry Skelton, jockey.

runners.spotlight: Regularly ridden by Heidi Palin (3-12 on him); recent efforts leave plenty to be desired, but it's possible to make excuses and he is now 1lb lower than when making all in this race last year; may face competition for the lead but still has to be taken seriously.

stable_tour.quote: He ran pretty well in a good handicap chase over two miles and one furlong at Ascot last time. He's been consistent but hasn't won for a while, although I'm sure it's coming his way. 12-11-24

runners.comment: Won five times in the autumn, but the handicapper may have caught up with him
runners.name: Shantou Lucky

prev_owners.owner: J Bedi, P Ellerby And Partners

quotes.race: Kilmanahan Beginners Chase
quotes.quote: Shantou Lucky ran very well at Leopardstown last time and he is taking to fences. He will stay on the go probably but he might not run on good ground - Gavin Cromwell, trainer.

runners.spotlight: Won five of his first six starts over hurdles/fences (2m4f-3m2f) after joining James Owen in September; the drop in trip shouln't be an issue, but heavy defeats the last twice suggest the handicapper may have caught up with him.

stable_tour.quote: He ran well enough at Fairyhouse this month. He'll mix and match between hurdles and fences and hopefully pay his way. 27-10-22

runners.comment: Handy sort; mainly consistent this year; possibilities on debut for new trainer
runners.name: No But I Will
runners.owner: Exors Of The Late Donald Smith
runners.spotlight: Handy sort who has been mainly consistent this year, including a win at Cartmel (2m1f, good) in August; well held when third of five at Chepstow (2m, good to firm) in October, but this ground should suit him better; possibilities on debut for new trainer back from a break.

stable_tour.quote: He did very well last season as he was a big baby and just struggled physically. He was a bit disappointing at Aintree on Sunday, but it was his first time in a handicap and he'll improve for the run. He's a 3m-plus chaser, who handles softer ground, and we'll go over fences now. 01-11-23

He's a nice youngster who won his point-to-point at Curraghmore by 30 lengths in the spring before joining us. He made his rules debut at Kelso last month over 2m6f when a close third. He stayed on the whole way up the straight and will be worth following , as he gains more experience. He ran last week at Haydock but never managed to get in a blow and the ground probably played a big part. There's plenty to come from him. 07-12-22

runners.comment: Has become disappointing and also looks tricky; hard to warm to on second start for yard
runners.name: Moon Hunter

quotes.race: bet365 British EBF "National Hunt" Novices' Hurdle (Qualifier) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Winning at Wetherby first time took a lot more out of Moon Hunter than I thought, he lost 27kg and he'd barely had a race. That's a lot to lose in an easy race and it surprised me - Henry Daly, trainer.

quotes.race: Dransfields CIU Novices' Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Moon Hunter is a horse to look forward to. We bought him after his point-to-point win and Henry said he'd done everything he wanted him to. We were hoping for a good run today and Tom said he travelled well and when the other horses came to him he quickened after the last - Martin Warren, part-owner.

runners.spotlight: Looked promising in his younger days when with Henry Daly (RPR 130), but has become disappointing and also looks tricky; hard to warm to on second start for yard.

runners.comment: Back off last winning mark and should be all the better for recent return; interesting
runners.name: Bolsover Bill
runners.spotlight: Regularly ridden by Victoria Malzard these days; back off the same mark as for the second of two wins at Exeter (2m3f) in January last year and was entitled to need his return from a 20-month absence over hurdles at Leicester three weeks ago; interesting.

14:45.race_name: Sky Bet Club Handicap Chase (GBB Race)

runners.comment: Running fairly well but beaten off a lower hurdle mark last week; could be vulnerable
runners.name: Enjoy Dallen

prev_owners.owner: The Ridgeway Racing For Fun Partnership

quotes.race: www.thurlesraces.ie Handicap Chase
quotes.quote: Enjoy D'Allen has the makings of a lovely horse, we've known that. He improved from the last day, confidence-wise more than anything. He really galloped to the line today. He impressed me. He hits a flat spot, maybe at the third or fourth last, but with more racing that won't happen. He'll be some horse at the end of the year. He seems to go on any ground. We'll keep him going as a novice - Ciaran Murphy, trainer

runners.spotlight: Beat Shadows In The Sky by 10l here over 2m5f in October but below that level since in tiny fields, over 2m7f and 3m1f (back hurdling off a lower mark); could be vulnerable with all his weight.

runners.comment: Still on a competitive mark but well beaten at Wetherby when back on soft ground
runners.name: Fern Hill
runners.owner: J E Harrison & Mrs S Case

quotes.race: quinnbet.com Handicap Chase (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: It's a much lower grade than Fern Hill's younger days. He's a had a few near-misses but it's been a long time since he last won. He was in a great rhythm and in his comfort zone all the way. It saw him to great effect and as he gets older, he's getting wiser. I'm delighted. He ran well all of last season without winning and it'd been frustrating not to get his head back in front. We know he's exposed, but he's been a good, fun horse over the years. Hopefully, he'll get his head in front again but it's all about today - Ben Case, trainer.

runners.spotlight: Career-low mark when scoring at Uttoxeter and followed up in another small field at Huntingdon (again on good at about 3m); still on a competitive mark but well beaten at Wetherby when back on soft ground; conditions are a worry.

runners.comment: Has questions to answer beyond 3m and may get outstayed when it matters
runners.name: Shadows In The Sky

prev_owners.owner: D & D Armstrong Ltd & L Westwood

runners.spotlight: May struggle to reverse October's course placings with Enjoy d'Allen even with a pull in the weights; that was over 2m5f and he still has questions to answer beyond 3m; may get outstayed when it matters.

runners.comment: Good strike-rate over fences and in form until an excusable defeat at Ascot a month ago
runners.name: Safe Destination
runners.spotlight: Good strike-rate over fences and bang in form until an excusable defeat at Ascot a month ago when he suffered interference late on; stays 3m2f and this far is worth a go; respected.

runners.breeder: Mrs Tessa Greatrex & Mr D Futter
runners.comment: Kept finding for pressure to finish third behind Safe Destination at Chepstow last time
runners.name: To Be Sure
runners.spotlight: Consistent 10yo who kept finding for pressure to finish third behind Safe Destination at Chepstow last time (3m2f, good to firm; a winner on soft) and this longer trip shouldn't be an issue.

runners.comment: Fair shout off this mark but slight concern that he may have a preference for drier ground
runners.name: He Is A Cracker
runners.spotlight: Two good runs and two modest ones since joining this yard, all of which were at Fontwell; 1lb out of the weights but goes well for Isabelle Ryder and he does stay well; a slight concern that he may have a preference for drier ground.

15:15.race_name: Sky Bet For The Fans Handicap Hurdle

runners.comment: Solid effort on penultimates start; may be suited by this new trip (stays 2m1f on Flat)
runners.name: Girl Of Gold

prev_owners.owner: R M Levitt And A Bromley

quotes.race: Sky Bet For The Fans Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: This is the first time Ben has ridden a winner in my Highflyer colours under rules. He has won on them in point to points. \hGirl Of Gold hung on the run-in but he had his stick in the right hand and she deserved to win - Anthony Bromley, owner and rider's Dad.

runners.spotlight: Record is 0-12 but she has shown consistency (form figures 223) since switched to hurdles and the penultimate effort is particularly solid; may be suited by this new trip (stays 2m1f on Flat); yard has won this race for the last two years; respected.

runners.comment: Absent for three months; scored at Worcester on last hurdles attempt; could go well
runners.name: Pooroldmackley
runners.spotlight: Has won over fences but was only a modest third returned to that sphere when last seen three months ago; scored at Worcester (2m7f, good) the time before, taking hurdles record to 2-10; could go well.

runners.comment: In-form maiden, having proved resurgent with placed efforts at Ludlow the last twice
runners.name: Isabel De Clare
runners.spotlight: Similar type to Girl Of Gold, being 0-12 overall but in form; has proved resurgent with placed efforts at Ludlow (2m5f) the last twice and remains 16lb below her opening mark; one of the main players.

runners.comment: Well treated on Flat form but achieved nothing on belated return to this code last time
runners.name: Doublethetrouble

prev_owners.owner: R W Hayward & Mrs B Wakelin
R W Hayward & E R Wakelin

runners.spotlight: Well treated on Flat form but achieved nothing on belated return to hurdles last time (2m4f) and is probably best watched unless the market suggests a bigger effort is likely; 0-5 in this sphere.

stable_tour.quote: We're not sure how much he enjoys hurdling but we're going to give him one more crack at it. We're going to take him to Fakenham on December 21 for a 3m 0-100 handicap. He's been a very consistent performer on the all-weather and looked well handicapped over hurdles, but he needs to run a bit better than he did first time out this season at Market Rasen. 10-12-25

runners.comment: Gained sole win in first-time cheekpieces; interesting off same mark in new headgear
runners.name: Lady Harriett
runners.spotlight: Inconsistent mare but her sole success coincided with wearing cheekpieces for the first time; back on the same mark and looks interesting assuming the switch to blinkers has a similar effect.

stable_tour.quote: She might be a chaser one day. She did win a novice handicap hurdle at Ffos Las in November and was then third at Southwell in another one. I think we'll try and find another low-grade one for her to try and win over hurdles but she's a chaser in the making in the longer term. 26-03-25

runners.comment: Best form over fences; has achieved little since returned to hurdles
runners.name: Annie Nail

quotes.race: Alan Boswell Group Mares' Handicap Chase (Queen Boudicca Mares' Chase Series Qualifier)
quotes.quote: Annie Nail has been a fantastic little buy and is a really tough mare. I couldn't watch the race after the first circuit - the nerves got the better of me - but having watched the replay she travelled brilliantly and won well. She shaped encouragingly at Hereford on her first start for us and we were confident coming into this - Tracey Leeson, trainer.

runners.spotlight: Chase form includes a Fakenham success in May; has failed to beat a rival in two starts since returned to hurdles, worsening an already unconvincing record in this sphere.

runners.name: Storm Thunder
runners.owner: Him Rock Racing Holdings Co Ltd
